intro: Calycogonium formonense, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are broad and lobed, and it produces elongated, fleshy fruits that are edible. The botanical features of Calycogonium formonense make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
